Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
And on `getbalance`, I just can't put in any parameter, or I'll get an error.

So, this works:

```
curl --user user2398463324:passf4bab3f0e4330392d885ed1a108fa09e640590b1f05d2da00181756bb3b93414b7 --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbalance", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:8032/
```

But this doesn't:
```
curl --user user2398463324:passf4bab3f0e4330392d885ed1a108fa09e640590b1f05d2da00181756bb3b93414b7 --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbalance", "params": [6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:8032/
```
although it will work as a terminal command, like so: 
```
komodo-cli getbalance 6
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Thanks, @dukeleto 

I suspect we need to add the following to the documentation, let me know also if this is correct.

```
While the `interest` property is returned for all KMD-based coin daemons, only the main KMD chain utilizes the interest feature. KMD-based asset chains will always return a `0.00` interest value .
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Another question:

The example in the documentation doesn't work for the optional parameters on this method.

```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=SIDDA z_importkey "ST17DVj1BhA4uisNpxHeFfX4DLYwJG3R81mhyia1pqrxQj3XPm8s" yes 10

error: Error JSON:yes

/komodo-cli -ac_name=SIDDA z_importkey "ST17DVj1BhA4uisNpxHeFfX4DLYwJG3R81mhyia1pqrxQj3XPm8s" "yes" 10

error: Error JSON:yes
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
This one gets a little closer:

```
komodo-cli -ac_name=SIDDA z_importkey "ST17DVj1BhA4uisNpxHeFfX4DLYwJG3R81mhyia1pqrxQj3XPm8s" '{"rescan":"yes"}' 10
error code: -1
error message:
JSON value is not a string as expected
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
This is from the Zcash documentation on the `z_shieldcoinbase` method.

Is the transaction size limit the same in KMD? Just checking.

```
Any limit is constrained by the consensus rule defining a maximum transaction size of 100000 bytes
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bryan_Beus your `interest` documentation is correct

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bryan_Beus yes, transaction size limit is currently the same as Zcash, it's a Sprout size limit (which all Zcash forks currently use). Currently Zcash is planning to upgrade to Sapling at the end of October and there will be no more max transaction size, and Komodo will become that way when James decides to merge all that stuff in at a future date üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: max transaction size will only be limited by block size

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bryan_Beus not sure what is up with z_importkey, note that as a potential bug

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I am not sure i like a single transaction that is the size of the block...

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the more I read about Zcash Sapling, the more work it sounds like it's going to be

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes it is a lot of work

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: to integrate into KMD and every other zcash fork. It almost feels like a "lets be incompatible to make to make it hard on others", or at least "we don't care if we make your life hard"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all mining pools must change their stratum implementations, for instance

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all raw transactions must change, a lot

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's a lot of stuff

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i dont understand why they changed the tx serialization format to add support for mempool expiration

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once it gets confirmed, who cares about what the mempool expiration was?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: they evidently thought expiring/stuck-in-mempool xtns are a big problem

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `hashReserved` is changing, and also for 2way replay protection you now always have to include a branch-id in raw transactions. it's a lot of changes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
James will love this part ... ``` Signature hashing
There are new SegWit-like features in this upgrade, such as transaction signatures committing to values of the inputs. We suggest reusing code from SegWit (e.g. for hashing transparent outputs) when implementing the new SignatureHash function. See ZIP 143 .```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i found this site which has been updated a lot and lists so many low-level changes: https://zcash.readthedocs.io/en/latest/rtd_pages/nu_dev_guide.html

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the zcash ecosystem itself will be updating stuff for months, many zcash forks will never have the resources to update and will stay on Sprout, most likely

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: network upgrades go live on Oct 28th and new private key format still isn't saved to disk....... üòø

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: oh, and they changed the format of Sapling addresses

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: every bit of Zcash code in the world that tries to verify what a valid ZEC address looks like, that needs to change, and downstream code that expects a certain base58 prefix or length

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the changes, they just go on and on

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all anybody wanted was faster shielded transactions

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: what we got, was a dump truck of "I hope this looks like we did a lot of useful stuff" that is a nightmare to upgrade to
